--   earliest end time in the time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toTime:EndTimeRange'</a>, <a>endTimeRange_toTime</a> - The
--   latest end time in the time range.
newEndTimeRange :: EndTimeRange

-- | The earliest end time in the time range.
endTimeRange_fromTime :: Lens' EndTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The latest end time in the time range.
endTimeRange_toTime :: Lens' EndTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An AWS resource event. AWS resource events and metrics are analyzed by
--   DevOps Guru to find anomalous behavior and provide recommendations to
--   improve your operational solutions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe EventClass -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [EventResource] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EventDataSource -> Maybe Text -> Event
[$sel:resourceCollection:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe ResourceCollection

-- | The class of the event. The class specifies what the event is related
--   to, such as an infrastructure change, a deployment, or a schema
--   change.
[$sel:eventClass:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe EventClass

-- | A <tt>Timestamp</tt> that specifies the time the event occurred.
[$sel:time:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An <tt>EventResource</tt> object that contains information about the
--   resource that emitted the event.
[$sel:resources:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe [EventResource]

-- | The name of the event.
[$sel:name:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the event.
[$sel:id:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The source, <tt>AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL</tt> or <tt>AWS_CODE_DEPLOY</tt>,
--   where DevOps Guru analysis found the event.
[$sel:dataSource:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe EventDataSource

-- | The AWS source that emitted the event.
[$sel:eventSource:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceCollection:Event'</a>, <a>event_resourceCollection</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventClass:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventClass</a> - The class of
--   the event. The class specifies what the event is related to, such as
--   an infrastructure change, a deployment, or a schema change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:time:Event'</a>, <a>event_time</a> - A <tt>Timestamp</tt> that
--   specifies the time the event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:Event'</a>, <a>event_resources</a> - An
--   <tt>EventResource</tt> object that contains information about the
--   resource that emitted the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Event'</a>, <a>event_name</a> - The name of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Event'</a>, <a>event_id</a> - The ID of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSource:Event'</a>, <a>event_dataSource</a> - The source,
--   <tt>AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL</tt> or <tt>AWS_CODE_DEPLOY</tt>, where DevOps
--   Guru analysis found the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventSource:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventSource</a> - The AWS
--   source that emitted the event.
newEvent :: Event

-- | Undocumented member.
event_resourceCollection :: Lens' Event (Maybe ResourceCollection)

-- | The class of the event. The class specifies what the event is related
--   to, such as an infrastructure change, a deployment, or a schema
--   change.
event_eventClass :: Lens' Event (Maybe EventClass)

-- | A <tt>Timestamp</tt> that specifies the time the event occurred.
event_time :: Lens' Event (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An <tt>EventResource</tt> object that contains information about the
--   resource that emitted the event.
event_resources :: Lens' Event (Maybe [EventResource])

-- | The name of the event.
event_name :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the event.
event_id :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The source, <tt>AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL</tt> or <tt>AWS_CODE_DEPLOY</tt>,
--   where DevOps Guru analysis found the event.
event_dataSource :: Lens' Event (Maybe EventDataSource)

-- | The AWS source that emitted the event.
event_eventSource :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS resource that emitted an event. AWS resource events and
--   metrics are analyzed by DevOps Guru to find anomalous behavior and
--   provide recommendations to improve your operational solutions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventResource</a> smart constructor.
data EventResource
EventResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EventResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that emitted an event.
[$sel:arn:EventResource'] :: EventResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the resource that emitted an event.
[$sel:name:EventResource'] :: EventResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of resource that emitted an event.
[$sel:type':EventResource'] :: EventResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:EventResource'</a>, <a>eventResource_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that emitted an event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventResource'</a>, <a>eventResource_name</a> - The name
--   of the resource that emitted an event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':EventResource'</a>, <a>eventResource_type</a> - The type
--   of resource that emitted an event.
newEventResource :: EventResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that emitted an event.
eventResource_arn :: Lens' EventResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the resource that emitted an event.
eventResource_name :: Lens' EventResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of resource that emitted an event.
eventResource_type :: Lens' EventResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The time range during which an AWS event occurred. AWS resource events
--   and metrics are analyzed by DevOps Guru to find anomalous behavior and
--   provide recommendations to improve your operational solutions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data EventTimeRange
EventTimeRange' :: POSIX -> POSIX -> EventTimeRange

-- | The time when the event started.
[$sel:fromTime:EventTimeRange'] :: EventTimeRange -> POSIX

-- | The time when the event ended.
[$sel:toTime:EventTimeRange'] :: EventTimeRange -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>EventTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromTime:EventTimeRange'</a>, <a>eventTimeRange_fromTime</a> -
--   The time when the event started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toTime:EventTimeRange'</a>, <a>eventTimeRange_toTime</a> - The
--   time when the event ended.
newEventTimeRange :: UTCTime -> UTCTime -> EventTimeRange

-- | The time when the event started.
eventTimeRange_fromTime :: Lens' EventTimeRange UTCTime

-- | The time when the event ended.
eventTimeRange_toTime :: Lens' EventTimeRange UTCTime

-- | Information about insight feedback received from a customer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInsightFeedback</a> smart constructor.
data InsightFeedback
InsightFeedback' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe InsightFeedbackOption -> InsightFeedback

-- | The insight feedback ID.
[$sel:id:InsightFeedback'] :: InsightFeedback -> Maybe Text

-- | The feedback provided by the customer.
[$sel:feedback:InsightFeedback'] :: InsightFeedback -> Maybe InsightFeedbackOption

-- | Create a value of <a>InsightFeedback</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InsightFeedback'</a>, <a>insightFeedback_id</a> - The
--   insight feedback ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedback:InsightFeedback'</a>, <a>insightFeedback_feedback</a>
--   - The feedback provided by the customer.
newInsightFeedback :: InsightFeedback

-- | The insight feedback ID.
insightFeedback_id :: Lens' InsightFeedback (Maybe Text)

-- | The feedback provided by the customer.
insightFeedback_feedback :: Lens' InsightFeedback (Maybe InsightFeedbackOption)

-- | Information about the number of open reactive and proactive insights
--   that can be used to gauge the health of your system.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInsightHealth</a> smart constructor.
data InsightHealth
InsightHealth' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> InsightHealth

-- | The Meant Time to Recover (MTTR) for the insight.
[$sel:meanTimeToRecoverInMilliseconds:InsightHealth'] :: InsightHealth -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of open reactive insights.
[$sel:openReactiveInsights:InsightHealth'] :: InsightHealth -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of open proactive insights.
[$sel:openProactiveInsights:InsightHealth'] :: InsightHealth -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InsightHealth</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:meanTimeToRecoverInMilliseconds:InsightHealth'</a>,
--   <a>insightHealth_meanTimeToRecoverInMilliseconds</a> - The Meant Time
--   to Recover (MTTR) for the insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openReactiveInsights:InsightHealth'</a>,
--   <a>insightHealth_openReactiveInsights</a> - The number of open
--   reactive insights.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openProactiveInsights:InsightHealth'</a>,
--   <a>insightHealth_openProactiveInsights</a> - The number of open
--   proactive insights.
newInsightHealth :: InsightHealth

-- | The Meant Time to Recover (MTTR) for the insight.
insightHealth_meanTimeToRecoverInMilliseconds :: Lens' InsightHealth (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of open reactive insights.
insightHealth_openReactiveInsights :: Lens' InsightHealth (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of open proactive insights.
insightHealth_openProactiveInsights :: Lens' InsightHealth (Maybe Int)

-- | A time ranged that specifies when the observed behavior in an insight
--   started and ended.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInsightTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data InsightTimeRange
InsightTimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> POSIX -> InsightTimeRange

-- | The time when the behavior described in an insight ended.
[$sel:endTime:InsightTimeRange'] :: InsightTimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time when the behavior described in an insight started.
[$sel:startTime:InsightTimeRange'] :: InsightTimeRange -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>InsightTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:InsightTimeRange'</a>, <a>insightTimeRange_endTime</a>
--   - The time when the behavior described in an insight ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:InsightTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>insightTimeRange_startTime</a> - The time when the behavior
--   described in an insight started.
newInsightTimeRange :: UTCTime -> InsightTimeRange

-- | The time when the behavior described in an insight ended.
insightTimeRange_endTime :: Lens' InsightTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time when the behavior described in an insight started.
insightTimeRange_startTime :: Lens' InsightTimeRange UTCTime

-- | Filters you can use to specify which events are returned when
--   <tt>ListEvents</tt> is called.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListEventsFilters</a> smart constructor.
data ListEventsFilters
ListEventsFilters' :: Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe EventClass -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EventDataSource -> Maybe EventTimeRange -> Maybe Text -> ListEventsFilters
[$sel:resourceCollection:ListEventsFilters'] :: ListEventsFilters -> Maybe ResourceCollection

-- | The class of the events you want to filter for, such as an
--   infrastructure change, a deployment, or a schema change.
[$sel:eventClass:ListEventsFilters'] :: ListEventsFilters -> Maybe EventClass

-- | An ID of an insight that is related to the events you want to filter
--   for.
[$sel:insightId:ListEventsFilters'] :: ListEventsFilters -> Maybe Text

-- | The source, <tt>AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL</tt> or <tt>AWS_CODE_DEPLOY</tt>, of
--   the events you want returned.
[$sel:dataSource:ListEventsFilters'] :: ListEventsFilters -> Maybe EventDataSource

-- | A time range during which you want the filtered events to have
--   occurred.
[$sel:eventTimeRange:ListEventsFilters'] :: ListEventsFilters -> Maybe EventTimeRange

-- | The AWS source that emitted the events you want to filter for.
[$sel:eventSource:ListEventsFilters'] :: ListEventsFilters -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListEventsFilters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceCollection:ListEventsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>listEventsFilters_resourceCollection</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventClass:ListEventsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>listEventsFilters_eventClass</a> - The class of the events you want
--   to filter for, such as an infrastructure change, a deployment, or a
--   schema change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:insightId:ListEventsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>listEventsFilters_insightId</a> - An ID of an insight that is
--   related to the events you want to filter for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSource:ListEventsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>listEventsFilters_dataSource</a> - The source,
--   <tt>AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL</tt> or <tt>AWS_CODE_DEPLOY</tt>, of the events
--   you want returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTimeRange:ListEventsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>listEventsFilters_eventTimeRange</a> - A time range during which
--   you want the filtered events to have occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventSource:ListEventsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>listEventsFilters_eventSource</a> - The AWS source that emitted the
--   events you want to filter for.
newListEventsFilters :: ListEventsFilters

-- | Undocumented member.
listEventsFilters_resourceCollection :: Lens' ListEventsFilters (Maybe ResourceCollection)

-- | The class of the events you want to filter for, such as an
--   infrastructure change, a deployment, or a schema change.
listEventsFilters_eventClass :: Lens' ListEventsFilters (Maybe EventClass)

-- | An ID of an insight that is related to the events you want to filter
--   for.
listEventsFilters_insightId :: Lens' ListEventsFilters (Maybe Text)

-- | The source, <tt>AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL</tt> or <tt>AWS_CODE_DEPLOY</tt>, of
--   the events you want returned.
listEventsFilters_dataSource :: Lens' ListEventsFilters (Maybe EventDataSource)

-- | A time range during which you want the filtered events to have
--   occurred.
listEventsFilters_eventTimeRange :: Lens' ListEventsFilters (Maybe EventTimeRange)

-- | The AWS source that emitted the events you want to filter for.
listEventsFilters_eventSource :: Lens' ListEventsFilters (Maybe Text)

-- | Used to filter for insights that have any status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListInsightsAnyStatusFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter
ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter' :: InsightType -> StartTimeRange -> ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter

-- | Use to filter for either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>
--   insights.
[$sel:type':ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter'] :: ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter -> InsightType

-- | A time range used to specify when the behavior of the filtered
--   insights started.
[$sel:startTimeRange:ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter'] :: ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter -> StartTimeRange

--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>listInsightsAnyStatusFilter_type</a> - Use to filter for either
--   <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt> insights.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeRange:ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listInsightsAnyStatusFilter_startTimeRange</a> - A time range used
--   to specify when the behavior of the filtered insights started.
newListInsightsAnyStatusFilter :: InsightType -> StartTimeRange -> ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter

-- | Use to filter for either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>
--   insights.

-- | A time range used to specify when the behavior of the filtered
--   insights started.
listInsightsAnyStatusFilter_startTimeRange :: Lens' ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter StartTimeRange

--   constructor.
data ListInsightsOngoingStatusFilter

--   insights.

--   insights.

-- | A filter used by <tt>ListInsights</tt> to specify which insights to
--   return.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListInsightsStatusFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListInsightsStatusFilter
ListInsightsStatusFilter' :: Maybe ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter -> Maybe ListInsightsOngoingStatusFilter -> Maybe ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter -> ListInsightsStatusFilter

-- | A <tt>ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter</tt> that specifies closed
--   insights that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
[$sel:closed:ListInsightsStatusFilter'] :: ListInsightsStatusFilter -> Maybe ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter

-- | A <tt>ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter</tt> that specifies ongoing insights
--   that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
[$sel:ongoing:ListInsightsStatusFilter'] :: ListInsightsStatusFilter -> Maybe ListInsightsOngoingStatusFilter

-- | A <tt>ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter</tt> that specifies insights of any
--   status that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
[$sel:any:ListInsightsStatusFilter'] :: ListInsightsStatusFilter -> Maybe ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListInsightsStatusFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>listInsightsStatusFilter_closed</a> - A
--   <tt>ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter</tt> that specifies closed insights
--   that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ongoing:ListInsightsStatusFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listInsightsStatusFilter_ongoing</a> - A
--   <tt>ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter</tt> that specifies ongoing insights
--   that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:any:ListInsightsStatusFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listInsightsStatusFilter_any</a> - A
--   <tt>ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter</tt> that specifies insights of any
--   status that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
newListInsightsStatusFilter :: ListInsightsStatusFilter

-- | A <tt>ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter</tt> that specifies closed
--   insights that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
listInsightsStatusFilter_closed :: Lens' ListInsightsStatusFilter (Maybe ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter)

--   that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.

-- | A <tt>ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter</tt> that specifies insights of any
--   status that are either <tt>REACTIVE</tt> or <tt>PROACTIVE</tt>.
listInsightsStatusFilter_any :: Lens' ListInsightsStatusFilter (Maybe ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter)

-- | Information about a notification channel. A notification channel is
--   used to notify you when DevOps Guru creates an insight. The one
--   supported notification channel is Amazon Simple Notification Service
--   (Amazon SNS).
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a
--   policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications.
--   DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send
--   notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics</a>.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key
--   Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add
--   permissions to the CMK. For more information, see <a>Permissions for
--   AWS KMS–encrypted Amazon SNS topics</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationChannel</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationChannel
NotificationChannel' :: Maybe NotificationChannelConfig -> Maybe Text -> NotificationChannel

-- | A <tt>NotificationChannelConfig</tt> object that contains information
--   about configured notification channels.
[$sel:config:NotificationChannel'] :: NotificationChannel -> Maybe NotificationChannelConfig

-- | The ID of a notification channel.
[$sel:id:NotificationChannel'] :: NotificationChannel -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:NotificationChannel'</a>,
--   <a>notificationChannel_config</a> - A
--   <tt>NotificationChannelConfig</tt> object that contains information
--   about configured notification channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:NotificationChannel'</a>, <a>notificationChannel_id</a> -
--   The ID of a notification channel.
newNotificationChannel :: NotificationChannel

-- | A <tt>NotificationChannelConfig</tt> object that contains information
--   about configured notification channels.
notificationChannel_config :: Lens' NotificationChannel (Maybe NotificationChannelConfig)

-- | The ID of a notification channel.
notificationChannel_id :: Lens' NotificationChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about notification channels you have configured with
--   DevOps Guru. The one supported notification channel is Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service (Amazon SNS).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationChannelConfig</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationChannelConfig
NotificationChannelConfig' :: SnsChannelConfig -> NotificationChannelConfig

-- | Information about a notification channel configured in DevOps Guru to
--   send notifications when insights are created.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a
--   policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications.
--   DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send
--   notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics</a>.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key
--   Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add
--   permissions to the CMK. For more information, see <a>Permissions for
--   AWS KMS–encrypted Amazon SNS topics</a>.
[$sel:sns:NotificationChannelConfig'] :: NotificationChannelConfig -> SnsChannelConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationChannelConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sns:NotificationChannelConfig'</a>,
--   <a>notificationChannelConfig_sns</a> - Information about a
--   notification channel configured in DevOps Guru to send notifications
--   when insights are created.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a
--   policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications.
--   DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send
--   notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics</a>.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key
--   Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add
--   permissions to the CMK. For more information, see <a>Permissions for
--   AWS KMS–encrypted Amazon SNS topics</a>.
newNotificationChannelConfig :: SnsChannelConfig -> NotificationChannelConfig

-- | Information about a notification channel configured in DevOps Guru to
--   send notifications when insights are created.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a
--   policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications.
--   DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send
--   notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics</a>.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key
--   Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add
--   permissions to the CMK. For more information, see <a>Permissions for
--   AWS KMS–encrypted Amazon SNS topics</a>.
notificationChannelConfig_sns :: Lens' NotificationChannelConfig SnsChannelConfig

-- | Information about whether DevOps Guru is configured to create an
--   OpsItem in AWS Systems Manager OpsCenter for each created insight.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOpsCenterIntegration</a> smart constructor.
data OpsCenterIntegration
OpsCenterIntegration' :: Maybe OptInStatus -> OpsCenterIntegration

--   OpsItem for each created insight.

--   insight.
newOpsCenterIntegration :: OpsCenterIntegration

-- | Specifies if DevOps Guru is enabled to create an AWS Systems Manager
--   OpsItem for each created insight.
opsCenterIntegration_optInStatus :: Lens' OpsCenterIntegration (Maybe OptInStatus)

-- | Information about whether DevOps Guru is configured to create an
--   OpsItem in AWS Systems Manager OpsCenter for each created insight.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOpsCenterIntegrationConfig</a> smart constructor.

-- | The time range during which anomalous behavior in a proactive anomaly
--   or an insight is expected to occur.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPredictionTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data PredictionTimeRange
PredictionTimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> POSIX -> PredictionTimeRange

-- | The time when the behavior in a proactive insight is expected to end.
[$sel:endTime:PredictionTimeRange'] :: PredictionTimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time range during which a metric limit is expected to be exceeded.
--   This applies to proactive insights only.
[$sel:startTime:PredictionTimeRange'] :: PredictionTimeRange -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>PredictionTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:PredictionTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>predictionTimeRange_endTime</a> - The time when the behavior in a
--   proactive insight is expected to end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:PredictionTimeRange'</a>,
--   <a>predictionTimeRange_startTime</a> - The time range during which a
--   metric limit is expected to be exceeded. This applies to proactive
--   insights only.
newPredictionTimeRange :: UTCTime -> PredictionTimeRange

-- | The time when the behavior in a proactive insight is expected to end.
predictionTimeRange_endTime :: Lens' PredictionTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time range during which a metric limit is expected to be exceeded.
--   This applies to proactive insights only.
predictionTimeRange_startTime :: Lens' PredictionTimeRange UTCTime

-- | Information about an anomaly. This object is returned by
--   <tt>ListAnomalies</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProactiveAnomaly</a> smart constructor.
data ProactiveAnomaly
ProactiveAnomaly' :: Maybe AnomalyReportedTimeRange -> Maybe AnomalyStatus -> Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe AnomalySeverity -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AnomalySourceDetails -> Maybe PredictionTimeRange -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AnomalyTimeRange -> ProactiveAnomaly

-- | A <tt>AnomalyReportedTimeRange</tt> object that specifies the time
--   range between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is
--   closed.
[$sel:anomalyReportedTimeRange:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe AnomalyReportedTimeRange

-- | The status of a proactive anomaly.
[$sel:status:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe AnomalyStatus
[$sel:resourceCollection:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe ResourceCollection

-- | The severity of a proactive anomaly.
[$sel:severity:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe AnomalySeverity

-- | The time of the anomaly's most recent update.
[$sel:updateTime:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Details about the source of the analyzed operational data that
--   triggered the anomaly. The one supported source is Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics.
[$sel:sourceDetails:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe AnomalySourceDetails
[$sel:predictionTimeRange:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe PredictionTimeRange

-- | A threshold that was exceeded by behavior in analyzed resources.
--   Exceeding this threshold is related to the anomalous behavior that
--   generated this anomaly.
[$sel:limit:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe Double

-- | The ID of a proactive anomaly.
[$sel:id:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the insight that contains this anomaly. An insight is
--   composed of related anomalies.
[$sel:associatedInsightId:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe Text
[$sel:anomalyTimeRange:ProactiveAnomaly'] :: ProactiveAnomaly -> Maybe AnomalyTimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>ProactiveAnomaly</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   anomaly.

--   recent update.

-- | Details about a proactive insight. This object is returned by
--   <tt>ListInsights</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProactiveInsight</a> smart constructor.
data ProactiveInsight
ProactiveInsight' :: Maybe InsightStatus -> Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe InsightSeverity -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InsightTimeRange -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PredictionTimeRange -> Maybe Text -> ProactiveInsight

-- | The status of the proactive insight.
[$sel:status:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe InsightStatus
[$sel:resourceCollection:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe ResourceCollection

-- | The severity of the proactive insight.
[$sel:severity:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe InsightSeverity

-- | The ID of the AWS System Manager OpsItem created for this insight. You
--   must enable the creation of OpstItems insights before they are created
--   for each insight.
[$sel:ssmOpsItemId:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe Text
[$sel:insightTimeRange:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe InsightTimeRange

-- | The name of the proactive insight.
[$sel:name:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe Text
[$sel:predictionTimeRange:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe PredictionTimeRange

-- | The ID of the proactive insight.
[$sel:id:ProactiveInsight'] :: ProactiveInsight -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   insight.

data ReactiveAnomaly
ReactiveAnomaly' :: Maybe AnomalyReportedTimeRange -> Maybe AnomalyStatus -> Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe AnomalySeverity -> Maybe AnomalySourceDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AnomalyTimeRange -> ReactiveAnomaly

-- | A <tt>AnomalyReportedTimeRange</tt> object that specifies the time
--   range between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is
--   closed.

--   triggered the anomaly. The one supported source is Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics.
[$sel:sourceDetails:ReactiveAnomaly'] :: ReactiveAnomaly -> Maybe AnomalySourceDetails

--   composed of related anomalies.
[$sel:associatedInsightId:ReactiveAnomaly'] :: ReactiveAnomaly -> Maybe Text

data ReactiveAnomalySummary
ReactiveAnomalySummary' :: Maybe AnomalyReportedTimeRange -> Maybe AnomalyStatus -> Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe AnomalySeverity -> Maybe AnomalySourceDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AnomalyTimeRange -> ReactiveAnomalySummary

-- | A <tt>AnomalyReportedTimeRange</tt> object that specifies the time
--   range between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is
--   closed.

[$sel:status:ReactiveAnomalySummary'] :: ReactiveAnomalySummary -> Maybe AnomalyStatus

[$sel:severity:ReactiveAnomalySummary'] :: ReactiveAnomalySummary -> Maybe AnomalySeverity

--   triggered the anomaly. The one supported source is Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics.
[$sel:sourceDetails:ReactiveAnomalySummary'] :: ReactiveAnomalySummary -> Maybe AnomalySourceDetails

-- | The ID of the reactive anomaly.
[$sel:id:ReactiveAnomalySummary'] :: ReactiveAnomalySummary -> Maybe Text

--   composed of related anomalies.
[$sel:associatedInsightId:ReactiveAnomalySummary'] :: ReactiveAnomalySummary -> Maybe Text
[$sel:anomalyTimeRange:ReactiveAnomalySummary'] :: ReactiveAnomalySummary -> Maybe AnomalyTimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>ReactiveAnomalySummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyReportedTimeRange:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_anomalyReportedTimeRange</a> - A
--   <tt>AnomalyReportedTimeRange</tt> object that specifies the time range
--   between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is closed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_status</a> - The status of the reactive
--   anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceCollection:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_resourceCollection</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_severity</a> - The severity of the reactive
--   anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDetails:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_sourceDetails</a> - Details about the source
--   of the analyzed operational data that triggered the anomaly. The one
--   supported source is Amazon CloudWatch metrics.

--   <a>$sel:id:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_id</a> - The ID of the reactive anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associatedInsightId:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_associatedInsightId</a> - The ID of the
--   insight that contains this anomaly. An insight is composed of related
--   anomalies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyTimeRange:ReactiveAnomalySummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveAnomalySummary_anomalyTimeRange</a> - Undocumented member.
newReactiveAnomalySummary :: ReactiveAnomalySummary

-- | A <tt>AnomalyReportedTimeRange</tt> object that specifies the time
--   range between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is
--   closed.
reactiveAnomalySummary_anomalyReportedTimeRange :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe AnomalyReportedTimeRange)

-- | The status of the reactive anomaly.
reactiveAnomalySummary_status :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe AnomalyStatus)

-- | Undocumented member.
reactiveAnomalySummary_resourceCollection :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe ResourceCollection)

-- | The severity of the reactive anomaly.
reactiveAnomalySummary_severity :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe AnomalySeverity)

-- | Details about the source of the analyzed operational data that
--   triggered the anomaly. The one supported source is Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics.
reactiveAnomalySummary_sourceDetails :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe AnomalySourceDetails)

-- | The ID of the reactive anomaly.
reactiveAnomalySummary_id :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the insight that contains this anomaly. An insight is
--   composed of related anomalies.
reactiveAnomalySummary_associatedInsightId :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
reactiveAnomalySummary_anomalyTimeRange :: Lens' ReactiveAnomalySummary (Maybe AnomalyTimeRange)

-- | Information about a reactive insight. This object is returned by
--   <tt>ListInsights</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReactiveInsight</a> smart constructor.
data ReactiveInsight
ReactiveInsight' :: Maybe InsightStatus -> Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe InsightSeverity -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InsightTimeRange -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReactiveInsight

-- | The status of a reactive insight.
[$sel:status:ReactiveInsight'] :: ReactiveInsight -> Maybe InsightStatus
[$sel:resourceCollection:ReactiveInsight'] :: ReactiveInsight -> Maybe ResourceCollection

-- | The severity of a reactive insight.
[$sel:severity:ReactiveInsight'] :: ReactiveInsight -> Maybe InsightSeverity

-- | The ID of the AWS System Manager OpsItem created for this insight. You
--   must enable the creation of OpstItems insights before they are created
--   for each insight.
[$sel:ssmOpsItemId:ReactiveInsight'] :: ReactiveInsight -> Maybe Text
[$sel:insightTimeRange:ReactiveInsight'] :: ReactiveInsight -> Maybe InsightTimeRange

-- | The name of a reactive insight.
[$sel:name:ReactiveInsight'] :: ReactiveInsight -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a reactive insight.
[$sel:id:ReactiveInsight'] :: ReactiveInsight -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReactiveInsight</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReactiveInsight'</a>, <a>reactiveInsight_status</a> -
--   The status of a reactive insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceCollection:ReactiveInsight'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsight_resourceCollection</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:ReactiveInsight'</a>, <a>reactiveInsight_severity</a>
--   - The severity of a reactive insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssmOpsItemId:ReactiveInsight'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsight_ssmOpsItemId</a> - The ID of the AWS System Manager
--   OpsItem created for this insight. You must enable the creation of
--   OpstItems insights before they are created for each insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:insightTimeRange:ReactiveInsight'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsight_insightTimeRange</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ReactiveInsight'</a>, <a>reactiveInsight_name</a> - The
--   name of a reactive insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ReactiveInsight'</a>, <a>reactiveInsight_id</a> - The ID of
--   a reactive insight.
newReactiveInsight :: ReactiveInsight

-- | The status of a reactive insight.
reactiveInsight_status :: Lens' ReactiveInsight (Maybe InsightStatus)

-- | Undocumented member.
reactiveInsight_resourceCollection :: Lens' ReactiveInsight (Maybe ResourceCollection)

-- | The severity of a reactive insight.
reactiveInsight_severity :: Lens' ReactiveInsight (Maybe InsightSeverity)

-- | The ID of the AWS System Manager OpsItem created for this insight. You
--   must enable the creation of OpstItems insights before they are created
--   for each insight.
reactiveInsight_ssmOpsItemId :: Lens' ReactiveInsight (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
reactiveInsight_insightTimeRange :: Lens' ReactiveInsight (Maybe InsightTimeRange)

-- | The name of a reactive insight.
reactiveInsight_name :: Lens' ReactiveInsight (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a reactive insight.
reactiveInsight_id :: Lens' ReactiveInsight (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about a reactive insight. This object is returned by
--   <tt>DescribeInsight.</tt>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReactiveInsightSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ReactiveInsightSummary
ReactiveInsightSummary' :: Maybe InsightStatus -> Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe InsightSeverity -> Maybe InsightTimeRange -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServiceCollection -> ReactiveInsightSummary

-- | The status of a reactive insight.
[$sel:status:ReactiveInsightSummary'] :: ReactiveInsightSummary -> Maybe InsightStatus
[$sel:resourceCollection:ReactiveInsightSummary'] :: ReactiveInsightSummary -> Maybe ResourceCollection

-- | The severity of a reactive insight.
[$sel:severity:ReactiveInsightSummary'] :: ReactiveInsightSummary -> Maybe InsightSeverity
[$sel:insightTimeRange:ReactiveInsightSummary'] :: ReactiveInsightSummary -> Maybe InsightTimeRange

-- | The name of a reactive insight.
[$sel:name:ReactiveInsightSummary'] :: ReactiveInsightSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a reactive summary.
[$sel:id:ReactiveInsightSummary'] :: ReactiveInsightSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | A collection of the names of AWS services.
[$sel:serviceCollection:ReactiveInsightSummary'] :: ReactiveInsightSummary -> Maybe ServiceCollection

-- | Create a value of <a>ReactiveInsightSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReactiveInsightSummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsightSummary_status</a> - The status of a reactive
--   insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceCollection:ReactiveInsightSummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsightSummary_resourceCollection</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:ReactiveInsightSummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsightSummary_severity</a> - The severity of a reactive
--   insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:insightTimeRange:ReactiveInsightSummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsightSummary_insightTimeRange</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ReactiveInsightSummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsightSummary_name</a> - The name of a reactive insight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ReactiveInsightSummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsightSummary_id</a> - The ID of a reactive summary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceCollection:ReactiveInsightSummary'</a>,
--   <a>reactiveInsightSummary_serviceCollection</a> - A collection of the
--   names of AWS services.
newReactiveInsightSummary :: ReactiveInsightSummary

-- | The status of a reactive insight.
reactiveInsightSummary_status :: Lens' ReactiveInsightSummary (Maybe InsightStatus)

-- | Undocumented member.
reactiveInsightSummary_resourceCollection :: Lens' ReactiveInsightSummary (Maybe ResourceCollection)

-- | The severity of a reactive insight.
reactiveInsightSummary_severity :: Lens' ReactiveInsightSummary (Maybe InsightSeverity)

-- | Undocumented member.
reactiveInsightSummary_insightTimeRange :: Lens' ReactiveInsightSummary (Maybe InsightTimeRange)

reactiveInsightSummary_name :: Lens' ReactiveInsightSummary (Maybe Text)

reactiveInsightSummary_id :: Lens' ReactiveInsightSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A collection of the names of AWS services.
reactiveInsightSummary_serviceCollection :: Lens' ReactiveInsightSummary (Maybe ServiceCollection)

-- | Recommendation information to help you remediate detected anomalous
--   behavior that generated an insight.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendation</a> smart constructor.
data Recommendation
Recommendation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomaly] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedEvent] -> Maybe Text -> Recommendation

-- | A hyperlink to information to help you address the problem.
[$sel:link:Recommendation'] :: Recommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | Anomalies that are related to the problem. Use these Anomalies to
--   learn more about what's happening and to help address the issue.
[$sel:relatedAnomalies:Recommendation'] :: Recommendation -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomaly]

-- | The reason DevOps Guru flagged the anomalous behavior as a problem.
[$sel:reason:Recommendation'] :: Recommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the recommendation.
[$sel:name:Recommendation'] :: Recommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | Events that are related to the problem. Use these events to learn more
--   about what's happening and to help address the issue.
[$sel:relatedEvents:Recommendation'] :: Recommendation -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedEvent]

-- | A description of the problem.
[$sel:description:Recommendation'] :: Recommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Recommendation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:link:Recommendation'</a>, <a>recommendation_link</a> - A
--   hyperlink to information to help you address the problem.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relatedAnomalies:Recommendation'</a>,
--   <a>recommendation_relatedAnomalies</a> - Anomalies that are related to
--   the problem. Use these Anomalies to learn more about what's happening
--   and to help address the issue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:Recommendation'</a>, <a>recommendation_reason</a> - The
--   reason DevOps Guru flagged the anomalous behavior as a problem.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Recommendation'</a>, <a>recommendation_name</a> - The
--   name of the recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relatedEvents:Recommendation'</a>,
--   <a>recommendation_relatedEvents</a> - Events that are related to the
--   problem. Use these events to learn more about what's happening and to
--   help address the issue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Recommendation'</a>,
--   <a>recommendation_description</a> - A description of the problem.
newRecommendation :: Recommendation

-- | A hyperlink to information to help you address the problem.
recommendation_link :: Lens' Recommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | Anomalies that are related to the problem. Use these Anomalies to
--   learn more about what's happening and to help address the issue.
recommendation_relatedAnomalies :: Lens' Recommendation (Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomaly])

-- | The reason DevOps Guru flagged the anomalous behavior as a problem.
recommendation_reason :: Lens' Recommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the recommendation.
recommendation_name :: Lens' Recommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | Events that are related to the problem. Use these events to learn more
--   about what's happening and to help address the issue.
recommendation_relatedEvents :: Lens' Recommendation (Maybe [RecommendationRelatedEvent])

-- | A description of the problem.
recommendation_description :: Lens' Recommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about an anomaly that is related to a recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationRelatedAnomaly</a> smart constructor.
data RecommendationRelatedAnomaly
RecommendationRelatedAnomaly' :: Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource] -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail] -> RecommendationRelatedAnomaly

-- | An array of objects that represent resources in which DevOps Guru
--   detected anomalous behavior. Each object contains the name and type of
--   the resource.
[$sel:resources:RecommendationRelatedAnomaly'] :: RecommendationRelatedAnomaly -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource]

-- | Information about where the anomalous behavior related the
--   recommendation was found. For example, details in Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics.
[$sel:sourceDetails:RecommendationRelatedAnomaly'] :: RecommendationRelatedAnomaly -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail]

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationRelatedAnomaly</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:RecommendationRelatedAnomaly'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationRelatedAnomaly_resources</a> - An array of objects
--   that represent resources in which DevOps Guru detected anomalous
--   behavior. Each object contains the name and type of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDetails:RecommendationRelatedAnomaly'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationRelatedAnomaly_sourceDetails</a> - Information about
--   where the anomalous behavior related the recommendation was found. For
--   example, details in Amazon CloudWatch metrics.
newRecommendationRelatedAnomaly :: RecommendationRelatedAnomaly

-- | An array of objects that represent resources in which DevOps Guru
--   detected anomalous behavior. Each object contains the name and type of
--   the resource.
recommendationRelatedAnomaly_resources :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedAnomaly (Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource])

-- | Information about where the anomalous behavior related the
--   recommendation was found. For example, details in Amazon CloudWatch
--   metrics.
recommendationRelatedAnomaly_sourceDetails :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedAnomaly (Maybe [RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail])

-- | Information about a resource in which DevOps Guru detected anomalous
--   behavior.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource
RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource

-- | The name of the resource.
[$sel:name:RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource'] :: RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the resource.
[$sel:type':RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource'] :: RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   resource.
--

--   <a>recommendationRelatedAnomalyResource_type</a> - The type of the
--   resource.
newRecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource :: RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource

recommendationRelatedAnomalyResource_name :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the resource.
recommendationRelatedAnomalyResource_type :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains an array of
--   <tt>RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail</tt> objects
--   that contain the name and namespace of an Amazon CloudWatch metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail
RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail' :: Maybe [RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail] -> RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail

--   information about the analyzed metrics that displayed anomalous
--   behavior.
[$sel:cloudWatchMetrics:RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail'] :: RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail]

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>recommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail_cloudWatchMetrics</a> - An
--   array of <tt>CloudWatchMetricsDetail</tt> objects that contains
--   information about the analyzed metrics that displayed anomalous
--   behavior.
newRecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail :: RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail

-- | An array of <tt>CloudWatchMetricsDetail</tt> objects that contains
--   information about the analyzed metrics that displayed anomalous
--   behavior.
recommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail_cloudWatchMetrics :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedAnomalySourceDetail (Maybe [RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail])

-- | Information about an Amazon CloudWatch metric that is analyzed by
--   DevOps Guru. It is one of many analyzed metrics that are used to
--   generate insights.
--   
--   <i>See:</i>
--   <a>newRecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail</a> smart
--   constructor.

RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail

--   CloudWatch metrics.

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--

--   The namespace of the CloudWatch metric. A namespace is a container for
--   CloudWatch metrics.

recommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail_metricName :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The namespace of the CloudWatch metric. A namespace is a container for
--   CloudWatch metrics.
recommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail_namespace :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedCloudWatchMetricsSourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about an event that is related to a recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationRelatedEvent</a> smart constructor.
data RecommendationRelatedEvent
RecommendationRelatedEvent' :: Maybe [RecommendationRelatedEventResource] -> Maybe Text -> RecommendationRelatedEvent

-- | A <tt>ResourceCollection</tt> object that contains arrays of the names
--   of AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS
--   CloudFormation stacks.
[$sel:resources:RecommendationRelatedEvent'] :: RecommendationRelatedEvent -> Maybe [RecommendationRelatedEventResource]

-- | The name of the event. This corresponds to the <tt>Name</tt> field in
--   an <tt>Event</tt> object.
[$sel:name:RecommendationRelatedEvent'] :: RecommendationRelatedEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationRelatedEvent</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:RecommendationRelatedEvent'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationRelatedEvent_resources</a> - A
--   <tt>ResourceCollection</tt> object that contains arrays of the names
--   of AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS
--   CloudFormation stacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RecommendationRelatedEvent'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationRelatedEvent_name</a> - The name of the event. This
--   corresponds to the <tt>Name</tt> field in an <tt>Event</tt> object.
newRecommendationRelatedEvent :: RecommendationRelatedEvent

-- | A <tt>ResourceCollection</tt> object that contains arrays of the names
--   of AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS
--   CloudFormation stacks.
recommendationRelatedEvent_resources :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedEvent (Maybe [RecommendationRelatedEventResource])

-- | The name of the event. This corresponds to the <tt>Name</tt> field in
--   an <tt>Event</tt> object.
recommendationRelatedEvent_name :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about an AWS resource that emitted and event that is
--   related to a recommendation in an insight.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationRelatedEventResource</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecommendationRelatedEventResource
RecommendationRelatedEventResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RecommendationRelatedEventResource

-- | The name of the resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to
--   the <tt>Name</tt> field in an <tt>EventResource</tt> object.
[$sel:name:RecommendationRelatedEventResource'] :: RecommendationRelatedEventResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to
--   the <tt>Type</tt> field in an <tt>EventResource</tt> object.
[$sel:type':RecommendationRelatedEventResource'] :: RecommendationRelatedEventResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationRelatedEventResource</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RecommendationRelatedEventResource'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationRelatedEventResource_name</a> - The name of the
--   resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to the <tt>Name</tt>
--   field in an <tt>EventResource</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':RecommendationRelatedEventResource'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationRelatedEventResource_type</a> - The type of the
--   resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to the <tt>Type</tt>
--   field in an <tt>EventResource</tt> object.
newRecommendationRelatedEventResource :: RecommendationRelatedEventResource

-- | The name of the resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to
--   the <tt>Name</tt> field in an <tt>EventResource</tt> object.
recommendationRelatedEventResource_name :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedEventResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to
--   the <tt>Type</tt> field in an <tt>EventResource</tt> object.
recommendationRelatedEventResource_type :: Lens' RecommendationRelatedEventResource (Maybe Text)

-- | A collection of AWS resources supported by DevOps Guru. The one type
--   of AWS resource collection supported is AWS CloudFormation stacks.
--   DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze only the AWS resources that
--   are defined in the stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS
--   CloudFormation stacks.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceCollection</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceCollection
ResourceCollection' :: Maybe CloudFormationCollection -> ResourceCollection

-- | An array of the names of AWS CloudFormation stacks. The stacks define
--   AWS resources that DevOps Guru analyzes. You can specify up to 500 AWS
--   CloudFormation stacks.
[$sel:cloudFormation:ResourceCollection'] :: ResourceCollection -> Maybe CloudFormationCollection

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceCollection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudFormation:ResourceCollection'</a>,
--   <a>resourceCollection_cloudFormation</a> - An array of the names of
--   AWS CloudFormation stacks. The stacks define AWS resources that DevOps
--   Guru analyzes. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.
newResourceCollection :: ResourceCollection

-- | An array of the names of AWS CloudFormation stacks. The stacks define
--   AWS resources that DevOps Guru analyzes. You can specify up to 500 AWS
--   CloudFormation stacks.
resourceCollection_cloudFormation :: Lens' ResourceCollection (Maybe CloudFormationCollection)

-- | Information about a filter used to specify which AWS resources are
--   analyzed for anomalous behavior by DevOps Guru.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceCollectionFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceCollectionFilter
ResourceCollectionFilter' :: Maybe CloudFormationCollectionFilter -> ResourceCollectionFilter

-- | Information about AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can use up to 500
--   stacks to specify which AWS resources in your account to analyze. For
--   more information, see <a>Stacks</a> in the <i>AWS CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:cloudFormation:ResourceCollectionFilter'] :: ResourceCollectionFilter -> Maybe CloudFormationCollectionFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceCollectionFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudFormation:ResourceCollectionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>resourceCollectionFilter_cloudFormation</a> - Information about AWS
--   CloudFormation stacks. You can use up to 500 stacks to specify which
--   AWS resources in your account to analyze. For more information, see
--   <a>Stacks</a> in the <i>AWS CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
newResourceCollectionFilter :: ResourceCollectionFilter

-- | Information about AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can use up to 500
--   stacks to specify which AWS resources in your account to analyze. For
--   more information, see <a>Stacks</a> in the <i>AWS CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
resourceCollectionFilter_cloudFormation :: Lens' ResourceCollectionFilter (Maybe CloudFormationCollectionFilter)

-- | Specifies one or more severity values and one or more status values
--   that are used to search for insights.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchInsightsFilters</a> smart constructor.
data SearchInsightsFilters
SearchInsightsFilters' :: Maybe ResourceCollection -> Maybe [InsightStatus] -> Maybe [InsightSeverity] -> Maybe ServiceCollection -> SearchInsightsFilters
[$sel:resourceCollection:SearchInsightsFilters'] :: SearchInsightsFilters -> Maybe ResourceCollection

-- | An array of status values used to search for insights.
[$sel:statuses:SearchInsightsFilters'] :: SearchInsightsFilters -> Maybe [InsightStatus]

-- | An array of severity values used to search for insights.
[$sel:severities:SearchInsightsFilters'] :: SearchInsightsFilters -> Maybe [InsightSeverity]

-- | A collection of the names of AWS services.
[$sel:serviceCollection:SearchInsightsFilters'] :: SearchInsightsFilters -> Maybe ServiceCollection

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchInsightsFilters</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceCollection:SearchInsightsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>searchInsightsFilters_resourceCollection</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statuses:SearchInsightsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>searchInsightsFilters_statuses</a> - An array of status values used
--   to search for insights.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severities:SearchInsightsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>searchInsightsFilters_severities</a> - An array of severity values
--   used to search for insights.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceCollection:SearchInsightsFilters'</a>,
--   <a>searchInsightsFilters_serviceCollection</a> - A collection of the
--   names of AWS services.
newSearchInsightsFilters :: SearchInsightsFilters

-- | Undocumented member.
searchInsightsFilters_resourceCollection :: Lens' SearchInsightsFilters (Maybe ResourceCollection)

-- | An array of status values used to search for insights.
searchInsightsFilters_statuses :: Lens' SearchInsightsFilters (Maybe [InsightStatus])

-- | An array of severity values used to search for insights.
searchInsightsFilters_severities :: Lens' SearchInsightsFilters (Maybe [InsightSeverity])

-- | A collection of the names of AWS services.
searchInsightsFilters_serviceCollection :: Lens' SearchInsightsFilters (Maybe ServiceCollection)

-- | A collection of the names of AWS services.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceCollection</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceCollection
ServiceCollection' :: Maybe [ServiceName] -> ServiceCollection

-- | An array of strings that each specifies the name of an AWS service.
[$sel:serviceNames:ServiceCollection'] :: ServiceCollection -> Maybe [ServiceName]

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceCollection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceNames:ServiceCollection'</a>,
--   <a>serviceCollection_serviceNames</a> - An array of strings that each
--   specifies the name of an AWS service.
newServiceCollection :: ServiceCollection

-- | An array of strings that each specifies the name of an AWS service.
serviceCollection_serviceNames :: Lens' ServiceCollection (Maybe [ServiceName])

-- | Represents the health of an AWS service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceHealth</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceHealth
ServiceHealth' :: Maybe ServiceInsightHealth -> Maybe ServiceName -> ServiceHealth

-- | Represents the health of an AWS service. This is a
--   <tt>ServiceInsightHealth</tt> that contains the number of open
--   proactive and reactive insights for this service.
[$sel:insight:ServiceHealth'] :: ServiceHealth -> Maybe ServiceInsightHealth

-- | The name of the AWS service.
[$sel:serviceName:ServiceHealth'] :: ServiceHealth -> Maybe ServiceName

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceHealth</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:insight:ServiceHealth'</a>, <a>serviceHealth_insight</a> -
--   Represents the health of an AWS service. This is a
--   <tt>ServiceInsightHealth</tt> that contains the number of open
--   proactive and reactive insights for this service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:ServiceHealth'</a>,
--   <a>serviceHealth_serviceName</a> - The name of the AWS service.
newServiceHealth :: ServiceHealth

-- | Represents the health of an AWS service. This is a
--   <tt>ServiceInsightHealth</tt> that contains the number of open
--   proactive and reactive insights for this service.
serviceHealth_insight :: Lens' ServiceHealth (Maybe ServiceInsightHealth)

-- | The name of the AWS service.
serviceHealth_serviceName :: Lens' ServiceHealth (Maybe ServiceName)

-- | Contains the number of open proactive and reactive insights in an
--   analyzed AWS service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceInsightHealth</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceInsightHealth
ServiceInsightHealth' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> ServiceInsightHealth

-- | The number of open reactive insights in the AWS service
[$sel:openReactiveInsights:ServiceInsightHealth'] :: ServiceInsightHealth -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of open proactive insights in the AWS service
[$sel:openProactiveInsights:ServiceInsightHealth'] :: ServiceInsightHealth -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceInsightHealth</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:openReactiveInsights:ServiceInsightHealth'</a>,
--   <a>serviceInsightHealth_openReactiveInsights</a> - The number of open
--   reactive insights in the AWS service
--   
--   <a>$sel:openProactiveInsights:ServiceInsightHealth'</a>,
--   <a>serviceInsightHealth_openProactiveInsights</a> - The number of open
--   proactive insights in the AWS service
newServiceInsightHealth :: ServiceInsightHealth

-- | The number of open reactive insights in the AWS service
serviceInsightHealth_openReactiveInsights :: Lens' ServiceInsightHealth (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of open proactive insights in the AWS service
serviceInsightHealth_openProactiveInsights :: Lens' ServiceInsightHealth (Maybe Int)

-- | Information about the integration of DevOps Guru with another AWS
--   service, such as AWS Systems Manager.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceIntegrationConfig</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceIntegrationConfig
ServiceIntegrationConfig' :: Maybe OpsCenterIntegration -> ServiceIntegrationConfig

-- | Information about whether DevOps Guru is configured to create an
--   OpsItem in AWS Systems Manager OpsCenter for each created insight.
[$sel:opsCenter:ServiceIntegrationConfig'] :: ServiceIntegrationConfig -> Maybe OpsCenterIntegration

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceIntegrationConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:opsCenter:ServiceIntegrationConfig'</a>,
--   <a>serviceIntegrationConfig_opsCenter</a> - Information about whether
--   DevOps Guru is configured to create an OpsItem in AWS Systems Manager
--   OpsCenter for each created insight.
newServiceIntegrationConfig :: ServiceIntegrationConfig

-- | Information about whether DevOps Guru is configured to create an
--   OpsItem in AWS Systems Manager OpsCenter for each created insight.
serviceIntegrationConfig_opsCenter :: Lens' ServiceIntegrationConfig (Maybe OpsCenterIntegration)

-- | An object that contains information about the estimated monthly cost
--   to analyze an AWS resource. For more information, see <a>Estimate your
--   Amazon DevOps Guru costs</a> and <a>Amazon DevOps Guru pricing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceResourceCost</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceResourceCost
ServiceResourceCost' :: Maybe CostEstimationServiceResourceState -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> ServiceResourceCost

-- | The state of the resource. The resource is <tt>ACTIVE</tt> if it
--   produces metrics, events, or logs within an hour, otherwise it is
--   <tt>INACTIVE</tt>. You pay for the number of active AWS resource hours
--   analyzed for each resource. Inactive resources are not charged.
[$sel:state:ServiceResourceCost'] :: ServiceResourceCost -> Maybe CostEstimationServiceResourceState

-- | The price per hour to analyze the resources in the service. For more
--   information, see <a>Estimate your Amazon DevOps Guru costs</a> and
--   <a>Amazon DevOps Guru pricing</a>.
[$sel:unitCost:ServiceResourceCost'] :: ServiceResourceCost -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of active resources analyzed for this service to create a
--   monthly cost estimate.
[$sel:count:ServiceResourceCost'] :: ServiceResourceCost -> Maybe Int

-- | The total estimated monthly cost to analyze the active resources for
--   this resource.
[$sel:cost:ServiceResourceCost'] :: ServiceResourceCost -> Maybe Double

-- | The type of the AWS resource.
[$sel:type':ServiceResourceCost'] :: ServiceResourceCost -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceResourceCost</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ServiceResourceCost'</a>,
--   <a>serviceResourceCost_state</a> - The state of the resource. The
--   resource is <tt>ACTIVE</tt> if it produces metrics, events, or logs
--   within an hour, otherwise it is <tt>INACTIVE</tt>. You pay for the
--   number of active AWS resource hours analyzed for each resource.
--   Inactive resources are not charged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unitCost:ServiceResourceCost'</a>,
--   <a>serviceResourceCost_unitCost</a> - The price per hour to analyze
--   the resources in the service. For more information, see <a>Estimate
--   your Amazon DevOps Guru costs</a> and <a>Amazon DevOps Guru
--   pricing</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:ServiceResourceCost'</a>,
--   <a>serviceResourceCost_count</a> - The number of active resources
--   analyzed for this service to create a monthly cost estimate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cost:ServiceResourceCost'</a>, <a>serviceResourceCost_cost</a>
--   - The total estimated monthly cost to analyze the active resources for
--   this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ServiceResourceCost'</a>,
--   <a>serviceResourceCost_type</a> - The type of the AWS resource.
newServiceResourceCost :: ServiceResourceCost

-- | The state of the resource. The resource is <tt>ACTIVE</tt> if it
--   produces metrics, events, or logs within an hour, otherwise it is
--   <tt>INACTIVE</tt>. You pay for the number of active AWS resource hours
--   analyzed for each resource. Inactive resources are not charged.
serviceResourceCost_state :: Lens' ServiceResourceCost (Maybe CostEstimationServiceResourceState)

-- | The price per hour to analyze the resources in the service. For more
--   information, see <a>Estimate your Amazon DevOps Guru costs</a> and
--   <a>Amazon DevOps Guru pricing</a>.
serviceResourceCost_unitCost :: Lens' ServiceResourceCost (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of active resources analyzed for this service to create a
--   monthly cost estimate.
serviceResourceCost_count :: Lens' ServiceResourceCost (Maybe Int)

-- | The total estimated monthly cost to analyze the active resources for
--   this resource.
serviceResourceCost_cost :: Lens' ServiceResourceCost (Maybe Double)

-- | The type of the AWS resource.
serviceResourceCost_type :: Lens' ServiceResourceCost (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service topic.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a
--   policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications.
--   DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send
--   notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information,
--   see <a>Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics</a>.
--   
--   If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key
--   Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add
--   permissions to the CMK. For more information, see <a>Permissions for
--   AWS KMS–encrypted Amazon SNS topics</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsChannelConfig</a> smart constructor.
data SnsChannelConfig
SnsChannelConfig' :: Maybe Text -> SnsChannelConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Simple Notification
--   Service topic.
[$sel:topicArn:SnsChannelConfig'] :: SnsChannelConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SnsChannelConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:SnsChannelConfig'</a>,
--   <a>snsChannelConfig_topicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   an Amazon Simple Notification Service topic.
newSnsChannelConfig :: SnsChannelConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Simple Notification
--   Service topic.
snsChannelConfig_topicArn :: Lens' SnsChannelConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | A time range used to specify when the behavior of an insight or
--   anomaly started.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data StartTimeRange
StartTimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> StartTimeRange

-- | The start time of the time range.
[$sel:fromTime:StartTimeRange'] :: StartTimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The end time of the time range.
[$sel:toTime:StartTimeRange'] :: StartTimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>StartTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromTime:StartTimeRange'</a>, <a>startTimeRange_fromTime</a> -
--   The start time of the time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toTime:StartTimeRange'</a>, <a>startTimeRange_toTime</a> - The
--   end time of the time range.
newStartTimeRange :: StartTimeRange

-- | The start time of the time range.
startTimeRange_fromTime :: Lens' StartTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The end time of the time range.
startTimeRange_toTime :: Lens' StartTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains the names of AWS CloudFormation stacks used to update a
--   collection of stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation
--   stacks.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCloudFormationCollectionFilter</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateCloudFormationCollectionFilter

--   can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.

--   up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.

--   can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.
updateCloudFormationCollectionFilter_stackNames :: Lens' UpdateCloudFormationCollectionFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | Starts the creation of an estimate of the monthly cost to analyze your
--   AWS resources.
module Amazonka.DevOpsGuru.StartCostEstimation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartCostEstimation</a> smart constructor.
data StartCostEstimation
StartCostEstimation' :: Maybe Text -> CostEstimationResourceCollectionFilter -> StartCostEstimation

-- | The idempotency token used to identify each cost estimate request.
[$sel:clientToken:StartCostEstimation'] :: StartCostEstimation -> Maybe Text

-- | The collection of AWS resources used to create a monthly DevOps Guru
--   cost estimate.
[$sel:resourceCollection:StartCostEstimation'] :: StartCostEstimation -> CostEstimationResourceCollectionFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>StartCostEstimation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:StartCostEstimation'</a>,
--   <a>startCostEstimation_clientToken</a> - The idempotency token used to
--   identify each cost estimate request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceCollection:StartCostEstimation'</a>,
--   <a>startCostEstimation_resourceCollection</a> - The collection of AWS
--   resources used to create a monthly DevOps Guru cost estimate.
newStartCostEstimation :: CostEstimationResourceCollectionFilter -> StartCostEstimation

-- | The idempotency token used to identify each cost estimate request.
startCostEstimation_clientToken :: Lens' StartCostEstimation (Maybe Text)

-- | The collection of AWS resources used to create a monthly DevOps Guru
--   cost estimate.
startCostEstimation_resourceCollection :: Lens' StartCostEstimation CostEstimationResourceCollectionFilter

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartCostEstimationResponse</a> smart constructor.
